question: 受け入れる
sourceMnemonic:
Remember 受ける (to receive something) and 入れる (to put in)? This just combines those two. You receive something, and put it into your heart. You accept it. So this verb means <vocabulary>to accept something</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>to take in</vocabulary>. 

You can use this verb for all kinds of acceptance, such as accepting an apology, accepting exchange students to your school, etc.
sourceReadingMnemonic: You should know how to read both 受ける and 入れる, so you should be good to go!
